subject: Sales
title: Decision Fatigue and Timing
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Decision Fatigue and Timing.

hook.text: Judges grant more paroles after lunch than before it. Tired brains default to 'no.' Timing matters.

buildup.text: Decision fatigue degrades our ability to choose wisely as the day's decisions pile up.

discovery.text: By afternoon, a buyer's brain has processed thousands of choices. Complex pitches crash on tired minds.

twist.text: The fix isn't only timing. Simplify the decision itself. Fewer options means far less fatigue.

climax.text: Pitch big decisions early in the day, early in the week, and with the fewest possible choices.

punchline.text: A rested mind says yes. A tired one says no.

quiz.question: What is decision fatigue?
options: Declining decision quality after many choices
